intro: Pararuellia alata, commonly known as the winged pararuellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its distinctive winged leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Pararuellia alata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
